Location.description: Specifies the relative URL that you can use in a GET data request.

Retry-After.description: The recommended wait time in seconds before calling the endpoint again.

async-query.description: Enables the asynchronous flow to get the data. By default, `false`.
async-query.name: async

end-query.description: End date in ISO 8601 format. Use this parameter together with `start`, or else replace both with a fixed `timeRange`.
end-query.name: end

queryId-path.description: Unique identifier of the previous asynchronous request to fetch report data.
queryId-path.name: queryId

reportingArea-path.description: The grouping of reports related to the same area.
reportingArea-path.name: reportingArea

start-query.description: Start date in ISO 8601 format. Use this parameter together with `end`, or else replace both with a fixed `timeRange`.
start-query.name: start

timeRange-query.description: Predefined time range, either `LAST_15_MINUTES`, `LAST_30_MINUTES`, `LAST_1_HOUR`, `LAST_3_HOURS`, `LAST_6_HOURS`, `LAST_12_HOURS`, `LAST_1_DAY`, `LAST_2_DAYS`, `LAST_1_WEEK`, `LAST_30_DAYS`, or `LAST_90_DAYS`. Use this as an alternative to a more flexible `start` and `end` time range. Support for specific time range values may vary by report type. See the report documentation under [Available reports](https://techdocs.akamai.com/reporting/reference/available-reports).
timeRange-query.name: timeRange

303.description: The request isn't processed. The response contains the `Location` header with the redirect link.
